page.title: 03Halling School
page.content: Halling school opened on Monday May 8th 1876.John Redfern was the first headmaster then John Scholey took over for the next 40 years,retiring in 1919 In 1976 the school celebrated its centenary by recreating the atmosphere of a Victorian school.A tree was planted in the school field and next to it was buried a time_capsule containing letters,coins and stamps. The original school buildings are still used by the present 92 pupils,4 teachers and ancillary staff.An air-raid shelter erected and used during the Second World War is still standing and in use as a store. School Houses are named after Mr. Scholey,William Lambarde author of "Perambulation of Kent",who lived in Halling during the 16th century and Bishop Gundulph who built the Bishop's Palace near the church.
